ygData.subject: Re: A question
ygData.msgSnippet: How do I get removed from the list? Sorry to bug everyone with this question...
ygData.messageBody:
How do I get removed from the list? Sorry to bug everyone with this
question...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sylvain Connan [SMTP:connans7@...]
> Sent: Monday, June 07, 1999 12:27 PM
> To: eqpaladin@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] A question
>
> From: Sylvain Connan <connans7@...>
>
> First I want to say out loud "HAIL and welcome back Val !!!". You were
> really missed ! I hope you will be done with your computer problems :)
> Those
> last weeks have been rather lonely expect for the occasional game with
> Merjol when we were on together...
>
> Now to try and answer Vilar's questions...
> Hail and welcome Vilar, I don't think I've had a chance to meet you yet :)
>
> (at least not under this name)
>
> >can you tell me are there cap for the combat skills of us
> >paladin?
>
> Aye like for every class and every (non trade) skills. Our cap for combat
> skills is I think 5*lev+5.
>
> >If not, than is it true that we could fight as good as those
> >warriors? If there are skill cap for our combat skills, well, the combat
> >advantage of us would be to obtain a holy sword, am I right?
>
> In pure melee fight, you won't be as good as a pure warrior. They will
> deal
> more damages and tank more easily (with their kick, double attack, double
> weapon, bash and all the other attacks they have). But they don't have any
>
> spell, and those spells are of a huge help when you're resting between
> fights. (and even during fights at a higher level).
> As far as the holy sword is concerned, well I'm lev 22 and still have to
> see
> one :) the weakest one is I think on a lev 30 monster, and I can't wait to
>
> get it...
> Anyway one thing you have to realize is that in a fight, and at higher
> levels, you won't really be here to do the damage - same for the warriors.
>
> Fight with some wizards who will in two spells take half of this monster's
>
> hps while you can hardly do a scratch... But teach them that if they run
> away when the monster turns on them, then you can't take the monster back
> on
> you ;)
>
> >I have a vision, sword is what we hold on our hand, but we are not fight
> >with the one we are swinging, we fight with the sword in our heart and
> THAT
> >should be our holy sword................
>
> Amen on this, sister.
> The point is to enjoy this game. Period. Personnally I do as a paladin.
> There's no point in thinking this class can do this better than me, and
> this
> other can do that better. Don't worry about that, it's pretty well
> balanced.
> And don't worry too much about the holy swords. You can perform your good
> duties througout Norath, fighting undeads and evil, even without one, and
> still be good at it :)
>
> May Brell guide your steps in the holy way of the paladinhood.
>
> Daramar (still no-name) - dwarf paladin, fidel servant of the Duke of
> Below.
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> ONElist: where real people with real interests get connected.
> http://www.onelist.com
> Join a new list today!
